text: Hi. Since I am relatively new to Julia was wondering if it is possible to fit HMM model to my multivariate data where the first two columns are following Normal distribution and the last two columns as binomial (success and failures) ? For example using finite mixture model example stated in Turing.jl and than using HMM. Thanks!

elements.text: Hi. Since I am relatively new to Julia was wondering if it is possible to fit HMM model to my multivariate data where the first two columns are following Normal distribution and the last two columns as binomial (success and failures) ? For example using finite mixture model example stated in Turing.jl and than using HMM. Thanks!

text: The quick answer is yes. Ideally you would marginalise out the discrete parameters in your HMM model to infer the parameters using HMC or NUTS.

elements.text: The quick answer is yes. Ideally you would marginalise out the discrete parameters in your HMM model to infer the parameters using HMC or NUTS.

text: Thanks. I will start looking into that. Hopefulyy it is not complicated.
